intro: Erigeron pallens, commonly known as the white fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its white to pale yellow flowers bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators like bees and butterflies. Erigeron pallens is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
